thread.title: Keegan Halloran has the distance for Phillipsburg boys soccer
thread.title_full: Keegan Halloran has the distance for Phillipsburg boys soccer

title: Keegan Halloran has the distance for Phillipsburg boys soccer
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Note to Skyland Conference boys soccer defenders: there’s nowhere on the field that shutting down Phillipsburg senior midfielder Keegan Halloran isn’t a good idea. 
North Hunterdon found that out on a perfect fall afternoon at the Philllipsburg Athletic Complex as Halloran’s long-range effort proved the Lions’ undoing and led to a 3-1 Stateliner win in a Skyland Conference Raritan Division game. 
Halloran showed why he is the all-time Phillipsburg goal-scoring leader in the 48th minute of a game tied at 1. 
Advancing the ball down the right side of the PAC’s well-manicured, closely-cropped pitch, Halloran watched the Lion defenders drop back to be able to intercept a pass or defend a long ball into the box. 
That seemed the smart play with Halloran at least 35 yards from the net. 
Wrong. 
“I saw the defenders dropping off and that is the signal to shoot,” he said. “I sometimes like to shoot from there.” 
It soon became obvious why. Halloran, at full tilt, stopped on a dime and rocketed a blast for the top right of the North Hunterdon net. Keeper Joe Vitovich got there but never had a chance to deny Halloran’s shot with that kind of power behind and it fizzed off Vitovich’s hands into the net. 
Sometimes long-range goals come from kicks that were meant as passes and wind up in the net. Not this time. 
“He meant that one!,” said one Phillipsburg fan. 
Halloran, who had scored the Stateliners' first goal in the first half, certainly did. 
“I knew it was going in as soon as I hit it,” he said. 
It’s precisely that kind of confidence that the best soccer goal scorers have. It can come off as egotistical, but it’s not; it simply reflects the confidence playmakers such as Halloran have to have to launch a shot from 30-plus yards and know it’s going in. No confidence, no goal. 
So, Skyland defenders: Halloran wears No. 10. He crosses midfield, best to shut him down. Or watch his confidence, his skills and his aim combine to find the net.
